column2: Brion was winning--if none of the watchers broke the impasse. His greater weight and strength counted now.
column3: Brion was winning-if none of the watchers broke the impasse. His greater weight and strength counted now.

column2: The Disan would have to drop the knife before his arm was dislocated at the shoulder. He didn't do it.
column3: The Disan would have to drop the knife before his arm was dislocated at the shoulder. He didn't do it.

column2: With sudden horror Brion realized that he wasn't going to drop it--no matter what happened.
column3: With sudden horror Brion realized that he wasn't going to drop it-no matter what happened.

column2: A dull, hideous snap jerked through the Disan's body and the arm hung limp and dead.
column3: A dull, hideous snap jerked through the Disan's body and the arm hung limp and dead.

column2: No expression crossed the man's face.
column3: No expression crossed the man's face.

column2: The knife was still locked in the fingers of the paralyzed hand.
column3: The knife was still locked in the fingers of the paralyzed hand.

column2: With his other hand Lig-magte reached across and started to pry the blade loose, ready to continue the battle one-handed.
column3: With his other hand Lig magte reached across and started to pry the blade loose, ready to continue the battle one handed.

column2: Brion raised his foot and kicked the knife free, sending it spinning across the room.
column3: Brion raised his foot and kicked the knife free, sending it spinning across the room.

column2: Lig-magte made a fist of his good hand and crashed it into Brion's groin.
column3: Lig magte made a fist of his good hand and crashed it into Brion's groin.

column2: He was still fighting, as if nothing had changed.
column3: He was still fighting, as if nothing had changed.

column2: Brion backed slowly away from the man.
column3: Brion backed slowly away from the man.

column2: Stop it, he said.
column3: Stop it, he said.

column2: You can't win now.	You can't win now.

column2: It's impossible." He called to the other men who were watching the unequal battle with expressionless immobility.
column3: It's impossible." He called to the other men who were watching the unequal battle with expressionless immobility.

column2: No one answered him.
column3: No one answered him.

column2: With a terrible sinking sensation Brion then realized what would happen and what he had to do.
column3: With a terrible sinking sensation Brion then realized what would happen and what he had to do.

column2: Lig-magte was as heedless of his own life as he was of the life of his planet.
column3: Lig magte was as heedless of his own life as he was of the life of his planet.

column2: He would press the attack no matter what damage was done to him.
column3: He would press the attack no matter what damage was done to him.

column2: Brion had an insane vision of him breaking the man's other arm, fracturing both his legs, and the limbless broken creature still coming forward.
column3: Brion had an insane vision of him breaking the man's other arm, fracturing both his legs, and the limbless broken creature still coming forward.

column2: Crawling, rolling, teeth bared, since they were the only remaining weapon.
column3: Crawling, rolling, teeth bared, since they were the only remaining weapon.

column2: There was only one way to end it.
column3: There was only one way to end it.

column2: Brion feinted and the Lig-magte's arm moved clear of his body.
column3: Brion feinted and the Lig magte's arm moved clear of his body.

column2: The engulfing cloth was thin and through it Brion could see the outlines of the Disan's abdomen and rib cage, the clear location of the great nerve ganglion.
column3: The engulfing cloth was thin and through it Brion could see the outlines of the Disan's abdomen and rib cage, the clear location of the great nerve ganglion.

column2: It was the death blow of kara-te.
column3: It was the death blow of kara te.

column2: Brion had never used it on a man. In practice he had broken heavy boards, splintering them instantly with the short, precise stroke.
column3: Brion had never used it on a man. In practice he had broken heavy boards, splintering them instantly with the short, precise stroke.

column2: The stiffened hand moving forward in a sudden surge, all the weight and energy of his body concentrated in his joined fingertips.
column3: The stiffened hand moving forward in a sudden surge, all the weight and energy of his body concentrated in his joined fingertips.

column2: Plunging deep into the other's flesh.
column3: Plunging deep into the other's flesh.

column2: Killing, not by accident or in sudden anger.
column3: Killing, not by accident or in sudden anger.

column2: Killing because this was the only way the battle could possibly end.
column3: Killing because this was the only way the battle could possibly end.

column2: Like a ruined tower of flesh, the Disan crumpled and fell.
column3: Like a ruined tower of flesh, the Disan crumpled and fell.

column2: Dripping blood, exhausted, Brion stood over the body of Lig-magte and stared at the dead man's allies.
column3: Dripping blood, exhausted, Brion stood over the body of Lig magte and stared at the dead man's allies.

column2: Death filled the room.

column2: Facing the silent Disans, Brion's thoughts hurtled about in sweeping circles.

column2: There would be no more than an instant's tick of time before the magter avenged themselves bloodily and completely.

column2: He felt a fleeting regret for not having brought his gun, then abandoned the thought.

column2: There was no time for regrets--what could he do _now_?
